summary: Biology encompasses the study of living organisms and their interactions in ecosystems, both traditional and modern. These ecosystems include biotic and abiotic factors and exist in specific geographic spaces and time periods. Recently, the concept has expanded to describe decentralized human organizations that operate across different spaces and times, requiring new conceptual models known as Ecosystem Architecture.
excerpt: Ecosystems traditionally involve biotic and abiotic interactions within a geographic space and time. Modern usage transcends this, describing decentralized human organizations that require new models and skills.
